talksYaml.title: Debugging with vim, tmux, and pudb
talksYaml.description: Ever found yourself stuck in a SSH session with some Python code that isn't behaving and the need to debug the code? Or are you just someone who prefers using vim and tmux like myself? What if there was a way to debug your code in an interface that doesn't require a huge IDE in order to run? This talk will guide you through using vim, tmux, and pudb to effectively debug code in various situations. We'll show how to insert breakpoints into the code and do remote debugging, all from the comfort of a tmux shell.
